sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hello and welcome to Euronews Now. Let's take a look at the latest headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As talks fail to produce a breakthrough on Ukraine, Russia says it's run out of patience and demands a response from NATO and the US. Ukraine calls for three-way talks with the US and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Downing Street apologises to the Queen for hosting two lockdown parties held on the eve of the funeral of her late husband, Prince Philip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Italy honours the President of the European Parliament, David Sassoli, as he's laid to rest with a state funeral.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And Novak Djokovic once again faces the possibility of being deported after the Serbian tennis player's visa is cancelled for a second time by Australia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hello and welcome to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Russian Foreign Minister, Sergei Lavrov, has warned the West that the Kremlin is running out of patience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: His comments come after a week of tense negotiations over military activity in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: NATO is calling on Russia to pull back its troops from Ukraine's eastern border meanwhile the u.s. says Moscow is preparing an operation to provide a pretext to invade Russia has denied any plans for military aggression and instead criticized NATO's expansion in Eastern Europe. Lavrov said military bases being established on the Sea of Azov are a step too far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the Baltic region and in other countries in Northern Europe, new bases are being established in the Black Sea, and the English are setting up a base in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They are building a base in the Sea of Azov and we categorically cannot accept this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is an unacceptable approach."

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian government has reported being the victim of a cyber attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Several key government websites, including the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, were taken offline following a suspected hack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Messages by the perpetrators were posted in Ukrainian Russian and Polish they warned Ukrainians that their personal data had been compromised the news follows Russia's latest troop movements which saw over 2,000 personnel taking part in drills near the Ukrainian border

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: our Russia analyst Galina Polanskaya says Russia is demanding a written response from NATO by next week. Sergei Lavrov today said that Russia is expecting a very quick written response from the United States on all of the proposals of Russia during those security talks. And he said that if the proposals are rejected, the situation will be assessed and reported to the President Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it will be Mr. Putin who will decide on the next step.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: All top Russian officials and diplomats have been saying that if the proposals are rejected, Russia will take all the necessary measures. But what those measures will be is not precise and today Foreign Minister Lavrov quoted once again Mr. Putin who at the end of December said that Russia could give a military technical response to the north to the natives eastward expansion and that it could be very different and it will depend on what military specialists will propose to mr. Putin so the question what will Russia do what will be its next step the US national security adviser Jake Sullivan says that the US intelligence has developed information that Russia has been preparing the groundwork to have the option of fabricating a pretext of the invasion in Ukraine, including sabotage activities by accusing Ukraine of preparing military actions in the east of the country. Russia has been denying any such of accusations and allegations and says that it does not plan any attacks on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, Ukraine is calling for fresh talks with Russia and the U.S.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Is President Putin likely to sit down with Biden and Zelensky?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Well, the Kremlin has not given any answer yet, but I would be very surprised if it happens, because you see, Russia says that, first of all, it is not a part in this conflict, and that Kyiv has to talk directly with the separatists in Donbas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia says that that's what the Minsk agreements say, and urges Kyiv to respect those agreements. We have been hearing this a lot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And right now, Russia made it clear that it wants written answers on behalf of the U.S.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And Minister Lavrov today said that it was only the United States who really could have a word in all of this situation around what is happening in ukraine so uh i don't think that vladimir putin is eager for such talks but of course any surprises are possible but what is for sure that mr putin is going to meet a president the president of china on the 4th of february he will go to china and will attend the opening ceremony of the olympics and will uh talk with xi jinping and of course I think the channel has also some questions about what is happening around Ukraine but once again Russia is expecting written answers and once guarantees that Ukraine will never become a part of NATO and today Minister Lavrov foreign minister Lavrov said that Russia's patience has run out Downing Street has issued an apology to the Queen following revelations of parties being held on the eve of Prince Philip's funeral.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The two staff events in April last year happened when government restrictions banned indoor socialising.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Although not in attendance, it's the latest lockdown party scandal to hit Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Opposition parties and voices from within his own government have called on him to resign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Our reporter in London, Tyege Enright, says this latest scandal exposes how government officials flouted rules while the Queen grieved alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Not only does it demonstrate disrespect to the Queen of England, the head of state, somebody who is respected, admired, even loved here, probably by most people in this country, but it also offers a stark illustration of the different interpretations of what it is to be a leader in a pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There, we saw the queen of England mourning the loss of her husband. At his funeral, she sat alone with no friends or family to comfort her, even though she knew she would never see him again. Whereas the night before, those working in political leadership were having not one, but two pretty major, pretty boozy parties, just because some among them were leaving their jobs. And it also offers more evidence that in all those times when Boris Johnson and his team in Downing Street have claimed that there were no breaches of COVID lockdown rules amid all these allegations of parties, it suggests that they indeed have been lying.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I mean, keep in mind when Boris Johnson apologised to Parliament here on Wednesday for another party which he attended.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He didn't actually admit wrongdoing, he was apologising for the impression caused by the controversy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Today, the Downing Street apologised to the Queen, but bizarrely it won't reveal exactly what it is apologising for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The long and short of it is, it's not ready to admit that there were illegal parties happening in Downing Street even though all evidence is pointing clearly towards that

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Germany has hit a new daily record of 92 000 covid-19 infections health minister Carl lauterback says the country is entering difficult Waters in tackling the pandemic and has repeated calls for mandatory vaccinations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Omicron variant now accounts for over 70% of new cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Health officials are optimistic that the strain is milder than the Delta variant, but are keeping restrictions in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Sweden's Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson has tested positive for COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Two other senior politicians have has tested positive for COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Two other senior politicians have also tested positive since.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Andersson's office says she's following medical advice and working from home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte says COVID-19 restrictions will be eased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They were among the most tough in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Shops, gyms and hairdressers are set to reopen, but hospitality businesses will remain shut. It comes as coronavirus infections reached record highs, while hospitalisations are approaching an 11-week low.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some teachers say schoolchildren are freezing cold as windows are opened to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: avoid the spread of COVID-19. But how practical is it to ensure adequate ventilation in the winter? Well earlier I spoke to Dr. Bharat Pankania, a senior clinical lecturer at the University of Exeter Medical School. He says you can adequately ventilate a room by using things like a carbon dioxide monitor without needing to open all windows.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good ventilation equals good flow of fresh air and I'm dealing with schools and nursing homes and similar outbreaks all the time every day at present and the advice I give to them is it is not a function of open all the windows, all the doors, freeze the place very cold in the winter. Children can't learn in such a cold environment and residents feel very cold. It is an issue of calibrating the room and it is entirely possible to calibrate the room, use a carbon dioxide monitor, for example, to always make sure it is in the green region and have a fresh flow of air. And that way, you know that with maybe one window, maybe two window, when it is fully occupied, the CO2 monitor always stays in the green zone. And that's one smart way of calibrating your room as well as not making it freezingly cold and uncomfortable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: How important are schools and offices in terms of the spread of the disease?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, we've noticed that whenever schools open, there is a start of infections there, which then slowly creeps up over the age groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: there which then slowly creeps up over the age groups so schools offices and similar places wherever there is a lot of human to human interactions are sources of infection and sources of spread of infection what more can be done to avoid the spread indoors and are there ways to improve ventilation without necessarily leading to freezing rooms?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Yes, indeed, as I've said, we can ventilate, we can ventilate properly without freezing the rooms and the classrooms. Furthermore, infection control is a multifaceted approach.
